Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that government has never created one job in the history of mankind and womankind.
Understate: The claim understates the role of government in job creation by ignoring the fact that many people work and retire from the federal government, and that local governments tend to be the biggest employers in their communities.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that government has never created one job.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that government is incapable of creating jobs.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that government does create jobs, as shown by the example of the U.S. Postal Service and local government employees.
